snippet: The Santorum comeback probably sets up a longer and more grueling campaign.
abstract: The Santorum comeback probably sets up a longer and more grueling campaign.
lead_paragraph: In a way, Rick Santorum's surprising Missouri-Minnesota-Colorado sweep last night is a lot like Newt Gingrich's win in South Carolina: A victory that reminds us all, once again, that Mitt Romney is a strikingly weak frontrunner, without changing the fact that Romney has a clear path to the nomination and his rivals really don't. The difference, though, is that Santorum is a stronger anti-Romney candidate than the combustible and compromised Gingrich, with wider geographic appeal (as he demonstrated last night) and fewer glaring liabilities. So whereas Romney was able to dispose of Gingrich pretty easily during the brief window where the race seemed to be down to a two-man race between them, if he gets into a two-man race with Santorum he's probably facing a much longer and more grueling contest.
